intro: Senecio tongolensis, commonly known as Tongolese groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
